programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: The 505 hosted an epic BKFC 59 and here are three of some of the greatest battles from the evening. Watch Felipe Chavez vs Leandro Torres, Justin Street vs Anthony Sanchez and Keith Richardson vs Frank Lester!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: A collection of UK battles including two UK title fights. Watch Christie vs. Round, Tenaglia vs. Lilley, Hodgson vs. Wasserman and Cooke vs. Oskar in fights of attrition in England.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Milton Keynes is one of several European homes for the BKFC and for good reason. The city never disappoints and the fighters throw down.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Clearwater, Florida is in competition with Miami for showcasing electrifying matchups and bare-knuckle talent. A unique venue hosts Richman vs Lozano in the main event, Fortt vs. Brito in the co-main and Ridge vs. Randall.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: An exciting bare knuckle fight between Justin Ibarrola vs Landon Williams opens up the show followed by Leonardo Perdomo vs Bobby Brents, Alberto Blas vs Daniel Alvarez, and Jomi Escoboza challenges Isaac Doolittle.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Featuring Ryan Reber vs Derek Perez, Chris Garcia trades hands with Albert Inclan, and Edgard Plazoala battles challenger Darrick Gates.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Nathan Rivera opens the show against Dustin Garrett, followed by Murat Kilimetov vs Tre Cook, Zack Calmus vs Josh Freeman, Cameron Vancamp vs Micah Terill and Brandon Shavers rounds out the action in the squared circle against Stanislav Grosu.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: We head to the squared circle to see Chrystal Van Wyk take on Christina Crist followed by Shawn Brooks in a fist fury with Jordan Christensen, and to finish it off James Brown Takes on Bovar Khanakov.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #6: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Masashi Oya is the chip leader ahead of Matthew Wantman, Justin Saliba, Martin Zamani, Jared Jaffee, Ken Aldridge, Anthony Hu, Jesse Lonis, and Dan Shak, as the final nine players play for the $223,100 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The stakes have been raised in Event #8, and Lou Garza holds the chip lead over the final five players. Chris Brewer, Darren Elias, Brock Wilson, and John Riordan all look to dethrone Garza as $427,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Pot-Limit Omaha returns, as does Lou Garza with the chip lead. Garza looks for retribution in Event #9 ahead of Sean Winter, Miles Rampel, Jeremy Ausmus, and Ben Lamb as $365,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Mikita Badziakouski holds the chip lead ahead of Ali Imsirovic, Daniel Negreanu, Jason Koon, and Seth Davies in Event 10. There is $342,000 awaiting the eventual winner, while Negreanu is eyeing the Poker Masters Purple Jacket.

programme.title: My Husband's Mistress
programme.desc: Behind the glamorous facade of the aviation industry, a dirty betrayal unfolds. A devoted wife's world is shattered when she discovers her husband's affair with her best friend. As the truth unravels, a battle for love, revenge, and survival ensues.

programme.title: Unfinished Business
programme.desc: After losing his brother, a local sheriff is on a desperate hunt for vengeance. But a revelation about his past makes him and his daughter targets.

programme.title: Weapons of Warfare
programme.desc: Raised in a religious household, a young man decides to pursue a life on the street, only to be torn between his family and the leader of his gang.

programme.title: White Lies
programme.desc: Two childhood friends partner on a lucrative hustle, oblivious to its true danger. Matters become more complicated after one develops feelings for the other's husband.

programme.title: You Ain't Gonna Believe This
programme.desc: Following the recent split with her longtime boyfriend Wayne, Jamerial embarks on a journey of a self-exploration and modern dating. Everything looks up until she finds out she might be potentially catfished by a new love interest, so her best friend reaches out to the show "You Ain't Gonna Believe This" to uncover the truth about this mystery man.

programme.title: A Masquerade Trapp
programme.desc: A pastor who is also a pimp gets caught up with another pimp's girlfriend.

programme.title: Black Diamond
programme.desc: At some point, we all have to choose a side: friends or family. This is a film about a diamond that was born a gem but raised as a savage.

programme.title: Blood or Not
programme.desc: Ten years with a squeaky clean record on the force, detective Ben Tucker isn't about to let his gangster brother Mike Mike take it all away.

programme.title: The Perfect Mother
programme.desc: Linda, a determined mother, faces the daily struggles of raising her son amidst the unpredictable presence of her husband. When a series of hardships push her to the edge, Linda's plea for assistance leads to Ahmad being taken into CPS custody.

programme.title: Make It Rain
programme.desc: A young woman struggling to find a job, stability, and a life after graduation turns to stripping to make ends meet.

programme.title: South Side Hero
programme.desc: After serving a 10-year sentence on a RICO charge, reformed gangster Tommy "Ace" Crown returns home to find his 15-year old daughter Sierra missing after she ran away with a man she met online. When the police decline to help, Ace is determined to track her down himself.

programme.title: Curse of a Father
programme.desc: A father's horrible mistake causes a lifetime of pain for his children. His son tries his best to live a normal life, but his childhood trauma follows him into his marriage. He must face his trauma head on to break this generational curse.

programme.title: Bottle Girl
programme.desc: Diamond's dream of going to college is threatened by financial hardship. A desperate job at a glamorous Atlanta lounge exposes her to a world of temptation and danger.

programme.title: Through Sickness and Hell
programme.desc: When a police officer is trapped in a toxic marriage, he must find the strength to break free from his abusive wife, risking his career, reputation, but also his life as he battles the damaging stigma surrounding domestic violence against men.

programme.title: The Right Ingredients
programme.desc: The story of four different couples with mismatched personalities, goals, and scenarios, and shows how a good relationship can take multiple ingredients, but it only takes the right one to make it last a lifetime.

programme.title: The Jealous Son
programme.desc: A woman falls for her boyfriend's charismatic son, and soon finds herself entangled in a dangerous obsession.

programme.title: Taboo 3: The Unforgettable Act
programme.desc: When Devin finally meets his soap star birth mother as an adult, feelings go beyond family love.

programme.title: Sweet Revenge

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow with a host of seasonal jobs to keep his autumn garden looking beautiful for as long as possible, and in the third of her fascinating films about how plants work, Carol Klein investigates the science of stems.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the fourth of her films about botany, Carol Klein explores the inner workings of leaves - how they harness the sun's energy and turn it into food. Joe Swift meets Griff Rhys Jones for a private tour of his remarkable garden and discovers what a passionate gardener he is.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the gardening year gets underway at Longmeadow, Monty is tidying up his ornamental grass border, pruning roses and planning for summer scent. Joe Swift continues his series on trees when he gives tips for how to plant a tree for future success.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts a new project, a cutting garden, and gives advice on what to grow to provide plenty of cut flowers for gorgeous summer bouquets. We visit Cumbria to meet Jack Gott, who has been passionate about that most flamboyant of flowers, the dahlia, for more than forty years and has over a thousand plants in his garden; and James Alexander-Sinclair celebrates a harbinger of Spring, the ephemeral cherry blossom, at Alnwick Castle in Northumberland.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This week we are celebrating the work of the army of volunteers, which keeps gardens up and down the country looking their best for visitors. Frances Tophill continues her vegetable trials at RHS Rosemoor in Devon, when she plants out her allotment with the help of RHS volunteers and we visit the Bodnant Garden in North Wales to find out how the volunteers there guide visitors through the world famous Laburnum Arch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Tender vegetables, bedding plants and bees are the focus of Monty's gardening at Longmeadow as he plants out squashes and scented annuals, and harvests honey. Adam Frost is in London, looking at how small spaces in the metropolis can be utilised to make gardens for wildlife, food and relaxation. Also, we visit North Wales to meet a man with a passion for prehistoric plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the longest day of the year approaches, there's more time to be outside and enjoy the garden and Monty is no exception. Although some vegetables do not respond well to a late sowing, there are others that do and Monty gives his tips on late croppers to sow now. Carol Klein and Joe Swift make a visit to Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham to revel in the hundreds of summer flowering plants on display and to find design tips for small gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst celebrating the glory of summer flowers at Longmeadow, Monty has plenty of tips, from pruning and propagation techniques for different types of clematis to troubleshooting problems with roses. Carol Klein wades through streams and marshes to show us how gardeners can emulate nature when choosing the right water plants for our gardens, and we visit Norfolk to revel in an extraordinary collection of iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is reaping the rewards of the summer when he begins to harvest crops from the vegetable garden and gives tips on extending the flower season in the borders. Carol takes a trip to the seaside to discover why some plants thrive, despite being assaulted by salt-laden winds. We make a final visit to Sissinghurst, to catch up with Troy Scott-Smith and the changes that have been made to the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer gets into full swing, there is plenty for Monty to be doing at Longmeadow. He gets to grips with summer pruning as he tackles his espaliered pear trees. Nature's bounty is very much in evidence at Lord Rothschild's garden at Waddesdon Manor, where we get an exclusive look behind the scenes. Also, Joe Swift ponders ways of putting a contemporary twist on traditional bedding plants.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel to the tropics with Bob Ross, stroll along the palm tree shores and drink in the soul-cleansing beauty of the sea. An oval masterpiece you'll enjoy.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Enjoy guest artist Dana Jester and his dark soft forest; discover the brilliance of the sun's glow bouncing off a quiet stream and majestic oaks.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Experience the serenity and silence of a fresh undisturbed snowfall with Bob Ross when he takes you to a lovely cabin deep in northern country.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross travels with his paint brushes into the density of an evening grove and discovers the beauty of a gentle, hushed rippling river.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Take a stroll into the woods with Bob Ross and experience the reflections of a jeweled sun bursting into the soft, vibrant day.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross teams up with Mother Nature and paints an incredibly awesome sky hovering over fantastic, snow-covered mountains and glass-like reflections.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: In a densely covered spot hidden far from the nearest roadway lies a softly nestled quiet little pond; Bob Ross invites you to take a peek.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A visit with Bob Ross takes you to a secluded cabin, snuggled deep into the blankety drifts of fluffy snow, far into the frozen mountains.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross employs some of his well-known oval magic to paint a lovely cabin scene situated in a serene, soft little rolling pasture.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: It's almost fall, and Bob Ross captures the undaunted power and charm of a mighty brown mountain surveying its rustic surroundings.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Talented guest painter Steve Ross shows you how to create a mirror-like lake spanning the width of snowy peaks and foothills.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder‚Äôs life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you‚Äôd see in a movie‚Ä¶in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly‚Äôs story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy‚Äîthat‚Äôs the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry‚Äôs own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: It disappeared for generations and seasons on end, only to return again. This time, rivaling the golden era of the past. Explore the history of the beginning of sportfishing and how it has influenced the most prestigious anglers in Southern California.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter‚Äôs Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan‚Äôs family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter‚Äôs pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest

With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan‚Äôs passion for saltwater fishing shines through. programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri‚Äôs gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the ‚ÄúShow Me‚Äù state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it‚Äôs no different. With Winchester‚Äôs in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America‚Ä¶the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can‚Äôt be measured in just one story, so we have three. programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: When debt collectors repeatedly try‚Äîand fail‚Äîto seize a horse from a stuntman (Jackie Chan), they unintentionally cause the duo‚Äôs funniest antics yet.

programme.title: The Monkey King: Reborn
programme.desc: When Monkey King frees a demon, his master is taken, and he must save him before Earth is destroyed.

programme.desc: Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz take a big-screen road trip with a car and a Long, Long Trailer.

programme.title: Gun Crazy
programme.desc: Bart and Annie share a passion for firearms and money. Together, the two go on a murderous crime spree.

programme.title: Quo Vadis
programme.desc: The epic tale of the love of a Christian woman that conquers a Roman warrior and the religion that ruled the greatest empire the world has known.

programme.title: Gunga Din

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: A bride attempts to turn her six brothers-in-law into gentlemen.

programme.title: Dead Ringer
programme.desc: Envious of her sister, a woman kills and impersonates her sibling, only to encounter scrutiny from a watchful police sergeant and a cunning suitor.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A biography of a man who is unjustly convicted of murder, gets locked up in French Guiana, and devotes his life to escaping from prison.

programme.title: Wagon Master
programme.desc: To survive a perilous crossing of the vast Utah desert, a band of Mormons must learn to collaborate with the people they meet on the trail.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: Because someone‚Äôs gotta do it, a Texas cattleman takes on the task of cleaning up the wild and lawless Dodge City while courting one of its women.

programme.title: Julius Caesar
programme.desc: A conspiracy to assassinate Julius Caesar ignites a desperate struggle for power in this adaptation of William Shakespeare‚Äôs tragedy.

programme.title: The Goodbye Girl
programme.desc: After her ex leaves and subleases their apartment without warning, an ex-dancer forms an unlikely home with the new tenant, a quirky struggling actor.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: The Corn Is Green
programme.desc: Bette Davis stars as a schoolteacher determined to help the people of a turn-of-the-century Welsh mining town.

programme.title: Cabaret
programme.desc: A carefree American singer, a British academic, and a wealthy baron become involved in a complicated love triangle as Nazism rises in 1931 Berlin.

programme.title: What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
programme.desc: After the devastating attack on Pearl Harbor, Lieutenant Colonel Jimmy Doolittle devises a plan for a daring raid to strike Japan.

programme.title: It Happened on 5th Avenue
programme.desc: A hobo gets more company than usual one year amid his annual tradition of moving into a wealthy man's vacant New York mansion for the winter.

programme.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
programme.desc: A young woman and her husband strike it rich and become European celebrities, but after her Titanic survival, she becomes an international hero.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Bounty (1962)
programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars as a first mate who leads his ship's exploited and abused crew through mutiny.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Robin Hood
programme.desc: In this swashbuckling classic, the legendary hero fights to rid England of the tyranny of Prince John and win the love of the beautiful Maid Marian.

programme.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
programme.desc: A family relocates from the city to the suburbs. Challenges ensue when a damaging play review leads a famed actress to target the husband.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a highly regarded Navy pilot is killed after crashing a new, high-tech jet at an air show, the team must determine if it was human or mechanical error.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates when a Navy drone pilot is murdered after using a black market drone to obtain military surveillance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When an Australian Royal Navy Lieutenant is murdered in New Orleans, Special Agent Naomi Parsons (Kate Beahan) is sent to work with Special Agent Pride.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a petty officer is found dead, the team's participation in the annual Red Dress Run comes to a halt.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team is baffled when a masked assassin kills a poker player during a high-stakes game.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After discovering another corpse without eyes, Horatio suspects his nemesis is to blame.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the murders of convicted killers after their release from prison.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio is determined to find a family that completely disappeared.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of the mother of a very young beauty-pageant contestant.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A killer uses an unusual, high-tech weapon to murder a genius billionaire.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a skydiver with more than 100 children, all of them suspects.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team steps in when multiple women are targeted during a murder spree at a Miami sorority.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a neighborhood do-gooder reveals he was planning on exposing something big.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When the Miami Taunter strikes again, Horatio meets with the matriarch of the suspected killer's family.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calliegh uncovers a personal connection to a case involving the near-death of a popular tennis coach.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio uncovers a scandal that pits him against a former adversary; Calleigh faces a life-altering decision.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When an enemy of the CSIs is killed, Horatio looks to his team for a suspect.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team searches for evidence and survivors after a jet crashes into the Everglades, trying to recreate what transpired on the fatal flight.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio sets out on a personal mission to find his mentor's killer, and Megan worries that he has become too emotionally involved in the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Megan examine the remains of a human torso found in a tiger shark's stomach. Wanda De Jesus guest stars.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When Mac's nemesis rigs Mac's house with explosives and traps him and Jack inside, Mac uses a karaoke mic and an audio transformer to let the team know that the bomb is a distraction for a bigger one.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac participates in a challenge to create robotic combat machines; Mac must help a competitor when her vehicle is hacked and heads for the Pentagon; Jack attends his high school reunion.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The team heads to New Orleans to track down a con artist posing as the wife of one of Jack's old CIA aliases; enemies of his old alias resurface looking for revenge.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: One of Murdoc's assassins agrees to hand over Murdoc to MacGyver in exchange for $10 million; the team finds itself protecting Murdoc from a former mentor who wants him dead; Jack realizes he may still have feelings for Riley's mother.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The team members pose as honeymoon couples at a resort in an attempt to befriend the son of a Serbian war criminal; Bozer wonders if Matty knows about his relationship with Leanna; Jack recruits Elwood to help him break into Matty's home.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac, Jack and Riley set out to find a mobster-turned-informant after he's kidnapped and taken to Chernobyl by an international crime boss; Bozer struggles to keep a secret from Matty.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team reunite with the Coltons, a family of bounty hunters, as they all search for a thief of classified intelligence.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: As Mac and the team investigate the suspicious death of Dawn's CIA supervisor, the evidence leads to a dirty CIA agent and a massive counterfeiting ring.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As the team searches for a vigilante killer in Cleveland, Rossi's former Marine sergeant goes missing in Los Angeles; J.J.'s secret catches up with her.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU learns of JJ's kidnapping, they discover that Cruz has also been abducted and delve into the files of a classified assignment; the team uncovers details of INTEGRITY, the covert database born out of the operation to find Osama bin Laden.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a pair of suspects responsible for several murders near Pittsburgh; Morgan and Garcia make Valentine's Day plans with their significant others.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU makes startling discoveries as they search for a 4-year-old girl who went missing while staying with a relative.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU must determine the true cause and motive when several drowned people are discovered in the Las Vegas desert.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Three bodies bitten by humans and animals are found in a shallow grave; Garcia and Reid hide their preparation for a company fitness test from Morgan.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan's visit with a survivor of unusual stabbings in upstate New York leads to more questions about the case.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The discovery of two murder victims in West Virginia uncovers a long-simmering feud between two families.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a commonality when a series of target abductions take place; Savannah is frustrated with Morgan's traveling.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When people are killed by arsenic poisoning and handwritten death threats are found, the team pursues a suspect fascinated by Greek mythology; Hotch is worried about participating in a Career Day at Jack's school.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for ¬£400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Among a bevy of beautiful vehicles being auctioned at no reserve are Simon Cowell's 1970 Triumph Spitfire MK III Convertible and John Mayer's 2006 Ford GT Heritage Edition!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Big bucks for Broncos and Mustangs as cowboys and cowgirls go head-to-head wrangling some of the best deals at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The bidding is fast and furious as celebrity vehicles cross the auction block; JFK, Rod Stewart, and Gen. Colin Powell are just some of the owners of cars selling at no reserve.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Ford versus Ferrari and Corvettes versus Chevelles as the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions continue to break records selling incredible vehicles in beautiful Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Highlighting the best of the best when it comes to classics from vintage Broncos and Chevy Blazers to Corvettes, GTO's, Austin Healys and Volkswagon buses.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A custom "boater-home" goes under the hammer at no reserve; the auction action intensifies when a 1970 Dodge Challenger HEMI creates a bidding frenzy.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Scottsdale auction moments.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Everyone is revved up and ready to go as Barrett-Jackson continues in Palm Beach, Fla.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bigger is better in Texas, and the Barrett-Jackson Live auctions in Houston prove it with cars like the 1957 Pontiac Bonneville and the Toyota GR Supra Launch Edition crossing the block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As the Barrett-Jackson Scottsdale Auction comes to an end, cars from throughout history cross the auction block; bidders go head to head for cars from the 1940s to the 2010s.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The fourth season of Ax Men returns and this year, the stakes are higher than ever.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard tries to tame two monsters at the same time--the super-juiced Mean Bean and the downhill site on which it's deployed. Pihl's greenhorn must prove herself to the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: On the edge of America's final frontier, it's every logger's worst nightmare: one of Papac Alaska's men has disappeared into thin air.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Papac Alaska, time is running out for missing logger Van Huffman. At Rygaard, Gabe gambles on a helicopter... and loses.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: It's a battle for survival in logging country. In Bayou country, Shelby's nighttime mission brings him face-to-face with an alligator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Logging country is turned upside down when one of the mountain's best bows out. At Papac Alaska, the men suffer under the reign of a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tonight, logging country is teetering on the edge. At Rygaard, Gabe lands on the wrong end of a volatile log pile.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Ax Men is hitting the freezing waters of southeast Alaska when a new tug boat company enters the fold. Charged with towing Papac Alaska's million-dollar payday to the mill.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, Craig's secret weapon arrives with a bang... but the crew's welcome of the new guy is far from warm. In Florida, Collins and Smith go log-for-log.

programme.desc: As the season reaches the halfway mark, logging country is feeling the pressure. In Florida, Swilley gets hooked in a pile of rusty metal.

programme.desc: Logging country is coming unglued. Rygaard is a war zone when the battle between chasers threatens to tear apart the entire crew. At Papac Alaska, Joe and Coatsy let the fists fly.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: While the competition between American loggers is more heated than ever... up north, there's a new game in town. Canadian top dogs are facing one of the toughest jobs ever.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: From coast to coast, logging companies are willing to do anything to stay on top. At Browning, the crew gambles on a slipping skyline.

programme.desc: There's a new crop of loggers in Ax Men country... but fitting in with the old guard ain't easy.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: From Canada to Louisiana, desperate times call for desperate measures. At Lemare, a washed out road threatens to trap their logs on the landing...

programme.desc: As the logging season winds down, the pressure to produce, heats up. In Alaska, a family emergency takes Mark from the yarder seat and with no time for a shut down.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A World War II Morse Code reader enters the shop; Rick negotiates for a letter written by John Quincy Adams; Corey takes over Rick's annual Fourth of July barbecue.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Playboy Club memorabilia comes into the shop; Corey and Chum check out some Murray bicycles; the Old Man goes to the shooting range.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick haggles for a moonshine still; a collection of 1940s and '50s autographed postcards; Chumlee is making phone calls during work.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An early version of "Rip Van Winkle" enters the shop; Corey and Chum deal for a candle shaped like President Nixon's head; the guys take the Old Man to play shuffleboard.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick haggles for an etching by Pablo Picasso; Corey and Chumlee deal for a bat signed by Bo Jackson; Chum is the first to join Rick's new book club.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Recently separated, Brandi and Jarrod find themselves at the same auction, and tensions flare; she gets the Laura treatment, and he regresses to his childhood self; Ivy schools Ivy Jr., who needs to find his footing.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: San Bernardino is full of surprises, particularly for Rene and Casey, who roll the dice on some sealed totes; Kenny stumbles over some odd-looking car parts; Lisa shields herself from disaster with an unusually expensive locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello can't wait to see what he can drum up this time around; Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it; Kenny does his best to fire up his profits; Brandi can't see the potential in the units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave does not intend to lose another great locker when the buyers return to Palm Springs, Calif.; Rene attempts some inside information; Ivy must buy big in order to make the trip worth his time; Mary enlists an unlikely ally.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Back in Montebello, Brandi and her buddy set the wayback machine and discover a roaring good time; Darrell makes the most of the little he's got; Kenny fills his piggy bank, while courting an unfamiliar pastime.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave goes after Jarrod and Brandi at a first-class auction in Arcadia, Calif.; Ivy makes an early move; Mary struggles to keep up with the competition amid soaring prices.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura hope for better units and better buyers; Rene tries to capitalize on warehouse sales and scoots away with a deal; Jarrod treats himself to a spa day; Darrell reflects on what it means to buy lockers full of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura take the buyers on a wild ride through the Inland Empire; Ivy gets an eyeful; Mary hopes to land treasure by purchasing early.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy brings his son to Moreno Valley, where good things always happen, and leaves with yo-yo's of an unexpected kind; Rene and Casey discover that their shoes are more "air" and less "Jordan."

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry utilizes a little-known tactic to snatch up a locker, and it ties him up in knots; Brandi shops in the bargain basement but puts on quite a show in the process; Ivy lands a large unit, and the tools stack right up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers get wind of some interesting units in Santa Clarita; Ivy and Isaiah choose quantity over quality; Brandi gets fancy sneaking a unit from everyone else; Kenny finds himself searching for his soul sister.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Dave fight for a pair of units in Moreno Valley, Calif.; Mavrick seeks a quality locker at a fair price; one lucky buyer scores a find that brings over $10,000 in profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tries to reclaim the title of King of Whittier but has trouble amassing any shillings; Ivy & Ivy brave the cold to find their fortunes; Lisa finally graduates to full-fledged buyer, finding an unlikely mentor along the way.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While picking in Pennsylvania, Danielle sends the guys to Bushkill Park--a century-old amusement park that's seen much better days.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While cruising through South Carolina, looking for leads, the guys call an old picking contact and soon find themselves in Bill's main street hardware store.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a 65-million year-old dinosaur bone; a 60s Bella German scooter; an antique audio recording device made from piano wire.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys stumble upon Woody the woodcarver's 80-acre property; the guys get first dibs on an aviation museum's once-in-a-lifetime sale, and their guide turns out to be an American hero.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys travel to Italy in search of a rare race car for an important museum client; Mike's old friend Flavio's sweet collection of retro motorbikes.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are determined to fill a shipping container with awesome artifacts they'd never find at home; an Italian mega-pick in Bologna; a sprawling collection that's stored underground in Roman catacombs.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A collector of high-voltage oddities reveals his stash; Mike and Frank are stonewalled by the Willett brothers.
